Yes, exactly! The settings are **automatically saved to your browser's localStorage** and will persist every time you visit the website from the same device and browser.

Here's how it works:

## üîÑ **Automatic Persistence**
- **All settings are saved instantly** when you change them (no "Save" button needed)
- **Automatically loaded** when you return to the website
- **Stored locally** in your browser's localStorage

## üì± **Device & Browser Specific**
- Settings are **tied to each browser on each device**
- Chrome on your laptop = separate settings from Safari on your phone
- Different user profiles in the same browser = separate settings

## üíæ **What Gets Remembered**
- Theme preferences (light/dark/system)
- Font size and display options
- Default translation languages
- Writing assistant preferences
- Notification settings
- All performance and privacy configurations

## üîÑ **Backup & Sync Options**
Since localStorage is device-specific, the settings modal includes:
- **Export Settings**: Download your preferences as a JSON file
- **Import Settings**: Upload settings file to sync across devices
- **Reset to Defaults**: Start fresh if needed

## ‚ö†Ô∏è **Important Notes**
- Settings persist **unless you clear browser data** or use incognito/private mode
- **No account required** - everything stays on your device
- **Privacy-focused** - your preferences never leave your browser

So yes, once you customize your translation experience, it'll be exactly the same every time you return to the website on that device! üéØ
